result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
CAUSE INJURY OWI(PASS <16), CAUSE INJURY - OPERATING W/PAC-PASS
CONDITIONS:  Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol consumption or possession.  Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.  Do not be on the premises of any bars or taverns.

02:42 PM Defendant JOSEPH LEE GRUNDY in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer & Intern Cunningham.  Defendant JOSEPH LEE GRUNDY in custody.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JOSEPH LEE GRUNDY appeared by video means with Attorney.  Given/has complaint. Advised of charges & potential penalties.  The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 2:47.  Further proceedings scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
